summary: This document is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Ghislaine Maxwell, commanding her to appear before the grand jury on July 24, 2019, to testify and produce documents related to alleged violations of federal sex trafficking and conspiracy statutes. It includes a cover letter requesting confidentiality and an attached 'Advice of Rights' form.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The document is a grand jury subpoena directly addressed to Ghislaine Maxwell, commanding her to appear and testify before the grand jury and to produce documents.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Geoffrey S. Berman is the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who signed the subpoena and the accompanying cover letter requesting confidentiality.

connections.description: Berman, as the U.S. Attorney, is the prosecuting authority issuing a grand jury subpoena to Maxwell, making her a target or witness in the federal investigation.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Grand Jury Appearance
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell is commanded to appear before the federal grand jury at the U.S. Courthouse in Foley Square, New York, to testify and give evidence.

events.title: Issuance of Grand Jury Subpoena
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office issues a grand jury subpoena to Ghislaine Maxwell in connection with an official criminal investigation of a suspected felony.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Borough of Manhattan, City of New York, New York
keyFacts: A federal grand jury subpoena was issued to Ghislaine Maxwell on July 7, 2019, compelling her to appear on July 24, 2019.

The subpoena is related to an investigation of alleged violations of federal statutes including 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 2421-2423 (transportation for prostitution, coercion, and sexual activity with minors), and 371 (conspiracy).
The U.S. Attorney's Office requested that the recipient voluntarily refrain from disclosing the existence of the subpoena to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.
The document includes an 'Advice of Rights' form informing the recipient of their right against self-incrimination and right to counsel.
The subpoena was issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York under the authority of U.S. Attorney Geoffrey S. Berman.
